intro: Oxydectes laurifolia, commonly known as the laurel-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils. Its leaves are thick and leathery, with a glossy appearance, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Oxydectes laurifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardiness and attractive foliage.
